page.title: 13Housing in Meltham
page.content: Most of the houses in Meltham were built of stone.The village spread with the rapid expansion of{David Brown's} in the sixties when the large estate at{Thick Hollins}was built.These newer type houses being of{brick and {pebbledash}differ somewhat from the characteristic{Yorkshire stone}of the village and the pre-war solid houses of the{Calmlands and Wetlands}areas. The majority of the people questioned lived in semi-detached accommodation with terraced houses a close second. There were few bungalows in the area. Detached housing appeared to be on the increase with the large new development at{Durker Roods.}Here the building in{Yorkshire stone}continues in keeping with the general character of the district.
